attires.name: Batik Shirt
attires.description: A versatile shirt made from traditional Indonesian batik fabric. Patterns and colors vary widely by region and occasion.

attires.name: Kebaya
attires.description: An elegant traditional blouse, often made of sheer material and adorned with intricate embroidery or lace. Worn with a sarong or batik skirt.

attires.name: Baju Koko
attires.description: A collarless long-sleeved shirt, often worn by Muslim men, especially during religious holidays like Eid al-Fitr.

attires.name: Surjan
attires.description: A traditional Javanese long-sleeved shirt for men, featuring a striped pattern and a unique collar design.

attires.name: Baju Bodo
attires.description: A brightly colored, short-sleeved sheer blouse, traditional to Bugis women of South Sulawesi. Often worn with a matching sarong and gold jewelry.

attires.name: Ulos Shawl
attires.description: A handwoven ceremonial shawl from the Batak people, draped over the shoulders or upper body, symbolizing blessings and respect.

attires.name: Baju Kurung
attires.description: A loose, long-sleeved tunic worn by Malay and Minangkabau women, often paired with a sarong or songket skirt.

attires.name: Baju Cele
attires.description: A traditional red-striped shirt from Maluku, worn with a sarong and belt, often during dances and ceremonies.

attires.name: Baju Sasak
attires.description: Traditional attire of the Sasak people of Lombok, featuring a long-sleeved shirt with unique woven patterns.

attires.name: Baju Adat Papua
attires.description: A traditional Papuan vest made from natural fibers, often decorated with shells and beads, worn during festivals and rituals.

attires.name: Baju Tutu
attires.description: A traditional Bugis men's shirt from South Sulawesi, often paired with a sarong and woven belt for ceremonies.

attires.name: Lipa Sabbe
attires.description: A handwoven silk shawl from Bugis-Makassar, South Sulawesi, worn draped over the shoulder or as a sash.

attires.name: Kebaya Bali
attires.description: A Balinese version of the kebaya, often brightly colored and worn with a sash (selendang) and batik or songket sarong.

attires.name: Kamen
attires.description: A long cloth sash worn by both men and women in Bali, wrapped around the waist over a kebaya or shirt.

attires.name: Beskap
attires.description: A formal Javanese jacket for men, often worn with a batik sarong and blangkon headdress during ceremonies.

attires.name: Kain Poleng
attires.description: A black-and-white checkered cloth from Bali, symbolizing balance, often worn as a sash or draped over the shoulder during rituals.
